problem.p: Which of the following statements is not true about Alan Turing ?

choicegroup.choice: The Turing Award is awarded annually in his honor, for technical or theoretical contributions to the computing community.
He helped win WWII by breaking German ciphers (encoded messages).

He invented a very simple "Universal Machine" (henceforth called a Universal Turing Machine) and proved that his machine was just as powerful (in terms of what it could compute) as any machine that could ever be built.
He eventually retired after a full career, as one of the most celebrated minds of his time.

div.p: Sadly, he lived at a time when British society did not tolerate his homosexuality. In 1952, he was charged with gross indecency, and given a choice between imprisonment or forced hormone treatment. He chose the treatment, which eventually made him impotent. Also, as a result of his conviction, his security clearance were revoked, preventing him from consulting for the British intelligence agency where he had been working.

He was found dead in 1954, when he was only 41 years old -- the official cause of death was cyanide poisoning, and an inquest determined he had taken his own life. In 2009, Prime Minister Gordon Brown released a statement (after a petition was circulated with thousands of signatures urging the government to apologize for prosecuting him as a homosexual), saying: "So on behalf of the British government, and all those who live freely thanks to Alan's work I am very proud to say: we're sorry, you deserved so much better."
